Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Emma111Reading
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and what a great place to stay. Beautifully decorated, excellent service and a top location without being in the real hub (15 mninute walk to San Marco). The staff were faultless and our room a real treat. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Style on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: Trips4JC
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel almost faultless. For a start, the location is perfect - walking distance from Piazza San Marco and many other tourist attractions, and good views over the Canal Grande, and yet far enough away from the bustle to feel really relaxing. Loved the stylish decor throughout the hotel. All the staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast buffet was fantastic. Our room had a large roof terrace, and the most comfortable pillows I've ever slept on!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I call a palace”
Reviews.Author: kazgray
Reviews.Content: On arrival we pulled up in a water taxi on their private jetty, a little disappointed that we wasn't greeted & we had to lug our suitcases into the hotel. We had asked for a canal view room, but ended up being placed in a room over looking the courtyard. We immediately asked to be moved which they did at extra cost. We was moved to a canal view room overlooking a construction site' the hotel opposite was being refurbished. We was woken at 6.00am most mornings by loud alarms going off & one night by cement mixer noises, most annoying. This work looks like it will be going on all summer, it should be made aware before booking as the rooms facing the canel have a premium price. On the plus side staff very helpful & attentive. The hotel is very well located, really enjoyed exploring all the little back streets where many little quaint shops, restaurants & little bars can be found.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, modern, exceptional hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Drew G
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better hotel to stay at in Venice! The location is on the Grand Canal across from the Piazza San Marco. This area is quieter and has many great galleries and shops as well as being right near the Peggy Guggenheim Collection. It is an easy walk to Piazza San Marco or an even easier Vaparetto ride (water bus)... there is also the traghetto which is a gondola to take you across to the other side. The hotel is the only modern, "boutique" type hotel I found in my search and it did not disappoint. Housed in a beautiful old palace, the hotel is thoroughly modern, well designed and comfortable inside. We had 2 rooms which I believe were amongst the smaller rooms but more than ample with oversized beautiful baths. The lobby and dining room are chic and elegant and overlook the canal. Having breakfast in the all white dining room with the canal unfolding in front of you is an experience. The breakfast was fantastic and the service in the dining room was superb. The front desk staff, especially Emanuelle and Mauro made the trip all the more enjoyable by arranging restaurant reservations and for a boat trip to Murano. A water taxi picked us up at the hotel's dock and took us without charge, and back, to the island where we were given a demonstration of the glass being made. Of course the hope is one will buy something and one cant resist buying something even it is a small souvenir item so this is a worthwhile activity (all in under 90 mins)....All the staff were friendly, helpful and would know which keys to give us when we returned back to the hotel. We were with two 14 year old nephews who were very impressed by this stylish hotel as were we....The staff even helped arrange for a special "thank you" cake that our nephews presented to us on our last day. I would return in a heartbeat to this hotel and recommend it to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay to remember!”
Reviews.Author: EngYew
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous! We stayed in a Jr Suite with a view of the Grand Canal in March. It is located on the Grand Canal right next to Santa Maria della Salute and close to the Peggy Guggenheim museum. The hotel has its own dock which water taxis use to pickup and drop off passengers. Very convenient if, like us, you are traveling with large bags. The reception and check-in was very pleasant . The staff were warm and friendly. Being a small hotel they try to greet everyone by name. A complimentary bottle of champagne and plate of fruits were presented shortly after we settled in the room. The room had two small balconies directly overlooking the Grand Canal. The view from the balconies were as good as it gets in Venice. Venice is constantly being repaired as its foundations slowly sinks, there are cranes everywhere and buildings covered for construction. The building across the canal from us was such a case. The suite was very nicely appointed with very high ceilings - 30ft tall I think. Spacious, fresh, bright and modern are words that come to mind. The gold tiled bathroom won me over! WiFi is an extra charge. (Tip: get a Telecom Italia TIM prepaid SIM card for free incoming calls and SMS and 30 days free unlimited internet for 12 Euros). Breakfast is included. The breakfast fare was pretty good and comparable to other 5 star hotels we stayed at. Of course, Italian espresso is excellent. Ask for a complimentary refill if you need more to wake up. In the afternoon, sit at the outside tables on the hotel dock and watch the boats go by, have tea to keep you going until dinnertime - 8pm at the earliest. From the hotel there are three ways to get to St Marks Square: you can walk there in 20 minutes across the Accademia bridge, take a 2 minute/one stop water bus ride from the Salute bus stop, or hop on the Maria Del Giglio gondola crossing service for 50 cents/person. We chose to walk there most days and take the bus back. The walk to St Marks takes you past so many beautiful shops, bridges, canals, and piazzas. Venice is such a photogenic city, getting lost is the best way to experience it, every turn is a delight. We had a wonderful time and the hotel is one that we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel ideal for a special holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, traditional exterior and contemporary luxury interior. Friendly, helpful staff. Convenient, quiet location with easy access to main attractions. Canal rooms have great views along the Grand Canal. We stayed in a split level luxury suite which was spacious and well furnished, although the bathroom was fairly small. Breakfast was very good. The private jetty is ideal for trips and airport arrival/departures via water taxis and the courtyard garden is very pleasant and great for relaxing in the afternoons. Several 'local' restaurants close by in Dosoduro are worth visiting and offer better quality and value than San Marco. A luxury hotel, ideal for a special holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel and place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mcgmjp
Reviews.Content: A very stylish hotel to stay in, good location with the river taxi only one stop away from St Marks. Staff generally helpful around the hotel. Rooms of a good size and stylishly designed, very high ceilings. Bathroom a tad on the bling side with a strange, dark shower/bath combination, with steps leading up into it. Food generally good for lunch and snacks. Breakfast offering was above average, busy most days. You are required to leave your room key at reception when you go out of the hotel - people may not always be used to this, but it was fine and had no security concerns with our room. I must commend the waitress we had one evening for a light dinner - outstanding and touching service - she was partially deaf, but she gave 100% care, concern and effort to her job with impeccable attention to detailed service from taking our order, ensuring it was totally correct, setting our table and giving us the most wonderful, warm, genuine smile when we ordered the house gelati selection and upon departure. Venice - well, some love it, I got over the romance for the place in a few hours after arrival. Eating out is expensive, it's a complex city to navigate, lots of architecture and gondolas to look at, St Marks is not that impressive and a lot of scaffolding around. Shopping isn't that great either! Water taxi to hotel is 60 euros...

Reviews.Title: “A Pampering Experience”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first (3 day) trip to Venice. What a wonderful experience, improved on every count by this hotel. We were 'upgraded' to a room with a view over the Grand Canal - very much a working thoroughfare, so very lively, to say the least, but also giving a real sense of being part of the city. The Hotel Gritti, across the canal is being rebuilt at present and is covered with a huge white blanket; (reason for upgrade perhaps?) This did not however detract from the excellence of this hotel, nor did the not overly spacious although beautifully presented room. The staff were wonderful. They were discrete but always available, seemingly able to predict our every need. Their knowledge of the city must be second to none. We shall return. Many thanks Centurion Palace, we loved staying with you,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location.”
Reviews.Author: ptarmigan11
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel. At Salute Water Bus stop you are only 2 minutes from San Marco - and can dip in and out as you want. We took a water taxi there and the Alilaguna line back to the airport. Both were really easy. Good buffet breakfast, room was large, we were right at the top of the hotel in the cheap seats - but still had a view of the Grand Canal. Loved Dorsoduro as an area, nice bars, places to eat and shop all just a 15-20 minute stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: DBMillman
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Centurion Palace. I loved that it was slightly away from the craziness, but so easy to get across the Grand Canal. The room was magnificent, the service was great. Everyone at the desk was extremely friendly. The breakfast in the morning was much better than I expected. Just a lovely vacation, which they made even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Centurion Palace”
Reviews.Author: Chris V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a three day break in Venice. The Centurion Palace hotel is beautifully located and well appointed.We were very happy with the room, the food and the service and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “gem in venice”
Reviews.Author: YVR_DXB
Reviews.Content: Was really happy to find this modern hotel with old charm in Venice. Expensive but provides great value for money and huge rooms by european standards (especially for Venice). Really recommend this hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star for Venice”
Reviews.Author: memch
Reviews.Content: If this was a hotel in London or a Maldives you can probably have better choices, but given how old a city venice is and how limited choices are when you are looking for a new, modern hotel I think they deserve 5 stars. If I spent a lot of time in my rooms some things would probably bother me though, like lack of plugs around the room to recharge batteries, or heating not working well enough to make the room go above 22 degrees. At the end of the day this hotel is in a wonderful location, away from the craziness of san marco but a one hop away by vaporetto. It has nice rooms and good service for European standards, what else can you really ask for in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: xAshx
Reviews.Content: Brilliant holiday. Hotel - Highly recommended. Only down side was we did not have a view of the Grand Canal but view was still ok. Would go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The only 5-star hotel on the Grand Canal with modern designer rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ly-Antho
Reviews.Content: If you want to splurge in Venice but do not like the gothic or rococo style of all the famous 5-star hotels in Venice, then you are left out with only one option: the Centurion. Superb architecture, very well located in front of the gritty, this modern hotel is a good pick. Rooms are pretty small though and food average.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Verytallbecca
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great location. Delicious buffet breakfast and very helpful staff. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Adverbatlarge
Reviews.Content: We had 5 beautiful nights in this magical city. This hotel made a great contribution to the spell. We had a room overlooking the grand canal and our son had an adjoining room. A friend from London joined us in another room. Arriving late we all dined in the hotel restaurant. It was great - don't miss it. But of course you won't because a charming breakfast is served there each morning. The noisy mod design is a good antidote for the floss of traditional Venetian interior design. The staff were fabulous. Best of all it is in Dosoduro, where the only morning sounds you hear are your own foot steps.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: transatlantics
Reviews.Content: Room - staff - food - location: exquisite. What a way to visit Venice for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: carpediem208
Reviews.Content: Location - We travelled to this hotel by the water bus Number 1 was the stop, which was right next to the hotel. Really easy to reach the main squares by foot as there were lots of bridges providing access from the hotel area elsewhere. Perfect! Staff - The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms - The room was an average size but had everything we needed. The bathroom was great also and we had a lovely big balcony, almost as big as the room. The internet was the only bad aspect of this hotel. We had to pay for cards and usage. Food - The breakfast was great and had everything you could want. We also had room service, and i would recommend the deserts. We ate our final meal in the hotel also, which was very nice and had interesting dishes on the menu. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: EdHarv
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy on our honeymoon last Fall. First stop...Venice. Stayed at the Centurion Palace and nothing compared for the rest of our 2-week honeymoon! Gorgeous rooms and lobby area, wonderful complimentary buffet breakfast each morning, non-smoking throughout the hotel and breathtaking location on the Grand Canal (just across the canal from St. Mark's). Simply the most magical, luxurious, breathtaking hotel in Venice...even all of Italy!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Jessica A
Reviews.Content: Centurion Palace was wonderful and we had a fantastic experience there, mostly because of the location and the wonderful canal-facing suite we reserved. Prior to booking we looked at a number of hotels in Venice as we wanted something a little more modern (than the average Venetian hotel) and we were so happy to have chosen Centurion. The rooms are incredibly decorated with soaring ceilings, exposed beams, and towering headboards. The balcony overlooking the Grand Canal is stunning and, having been to Venice before, it permits a completely different and wonderful experience. The staff were pleasant and very helpful, too. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: rantau_abang
Reviews.Content: Super hotel just across canal from San Marco and just up the street from the Guggneheim Museum. Wonderful helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of our Venice visit”
Reviews.Author: LindaNZ
Reviews.Content: We specifically booked Centurion Palace for its location on the Grand Canal, and for its modern decor with a sense of fun. We had been to Venice before and stayed on the Riva, and much preferred this location. I can honestly say that the hotel was the highlight of Venice for us this time. We had booked a deluxe room, but we were upgraded to a junior suite on the corner. They didn't tell us at reception, but just showed us to our room, then casually but deliberately opened the curtains to our exclamations of delight, as we saw a view of the Grand Canal from one window, and the Riva and La Salute from another. Our room was a delight - the eclectic decor, with a white stone fireplace, amazing ceiling, orange walls, and gold bathroom. Great fun, but with a sense of style, and plenty of space. Everything was clean and in working order. I was surprised at some of the negative comments around the time we visited, because we couldn't have been happier. (Well, actually, we could have been happier if wi-f- had been provided free to the rooms. On our 5 week trip we found that smaller cheaper hotels would provide free wi-fi, but in luxury five-star hotels like the Grande Bretagne in Athens and here in Venice hotel guests were charged for it. It seems unnecessary.) Anyway, wi-fi aside (and there is a computer with internet access near the lobby), I didn't really want to leave the room! The views from our windows were constantly changing, and we snapped so many photos out the window at all times of the day. And if we tired of the views, we gazed at the ceiling! We arrived early in the morning after getting off a cruise ship. This was no problem, as the reception staff looked after us, stored our bags, and checked we knew where we were and how to get around. The Peggy Guggenheim is very close, and I recommend visiting it (closed on Tuesday) if you can. In fact, we have to commend the reception staff, because again they had been the brunt of some negative comments. We found them without hesitation polite and helpful. Emanuel was particularly helpful, and when we couldn't get into a preferred restaurant for dinner, recommended another - La Piscine - about a 5 minute walk (away from the Grand Canal but still on the water). We had a delicious meal there, for about half the price of the original restaurant we had tried to reserve (but was closed on a Tuesday). Breakfast at the hotel is excellent, with a broad selection of food and good coffee. Eat out on the terrace (if you can get a table) or in the restaurant itself. We also had drinks and nibbles on the terrace in front of the lobby in the evening - a lovely place for a bellini (though it's not cheap). We arrived by vaporetto from Piazza Roma. Whilst travelling on vaporetto with luggage can be a bit of a pain (evil looks from other commuters/passengers), it is much cheaper than the water taxi, and as No.1 Vaporetto starts at the Piazza Roma, there was no problem getting a seat. It stops at La Salute. You get off, take the small bridge to the right (a few steps, but not onerous), walk through a small alleyway, and you're at the Centurion Palace entrance. Couldn't be easier. We did take the water taxi to the station when we left (booked in advance by Emanuel - give yourself plenty of time for it to arrive), it was about 60 euro, and a fast but entertaining trip. Everywhere else in Venice is within walking distance. I couldn't recommend the Centurion Palace highly enough, and would stay there again without hesitation. Its location on the Grand Canal, but still close enough to see the Riva, is unequalled.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Alexdv
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Centurion (albeit too brief)... Welcoming reception after arriving via boat taxi from Santa Lucia rail station. Venice is obviously not a cheap place but I can't stress the following enough: YOU MUST TAKE THE WATER TAXI if you are handling any baggage. It's the best 60euro (each way) I spent on the whole trip. It's impossible to carry any heavy luggage over all the little canal bridges. Also, the arrival via the grand canal directly to the hotel's dock is really an amazing experience. The room was small but beautifully decorated. Yes the place is already showing some wear but it's to be expected. Honestly, comparing it to comparably priced alternatives, you can't do better!! Breakfast was really nice overlooking the grand canal. You are about a 5 minute walk to the Accademia Bridge and from there about another 10 to either Rialto or St Marks. A lot of more reasonably priced restaurants are on this side of the Grand Canal. I can't say enough about the service of the front staff: friendly, professional, helpful. They Arranged the return taxi and it was 5minutes early! I agree with others that Internet should be included but, that being said, the system the SINA hotel chain uses is efficient and user friendly despite being expensive. In conclusion, would definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OneTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: First time to Venice and loved the hotel that I selected! Great location (right on the Grand Canal!) and just stunning from the moment I saw the property. As I checked-in, I was greeted by gracious staff AND the GM. My room was fabulous and it did overlook the Grand Canal; amenities: perfect! The staff was attentive, gracious and very helpful to this tourist. The restaurant was equally great; loved morning breakfast and enjoyed dinner as well. Kudos to all staff and compliments to the General Manager, Paolo; a well run hotel! I highly recommend this hotel and once I return to Italy, I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Retreat”
Reviews.Author: GARZOT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Centurion Palace for our 10th Anniversary. I cannot recommend arriving by water taxi enough and you don't need to pre-book this in advance. It's cheaper and just as easy by arranging on arrival at Marco Polo aiport (110 Euros set fee for taxi regardless of number of occupants). The hotel looked fabulous as we pulled up on the Grand Canal and we felt very fortunate. It has one of the best locations and is one of the most beautiful buildings on the canal as well one of the most photographed. The staff were welcoming and discreet. Our room, although sadly not overlooking the grand canal due to the full occupancy during our stay, was still one of the nicest rooms we've stayed in. It was well equipped and we loved the quirky, contemporary but quality finish. The bed and pillows were really comfy - a rareity these days and in contrast to previous reviews, the supplies were topped up daily, bins emptied and no leaking showers. We loved having breakfast overlooking the grand canal and even though there were only 6 tables on the terrace we managed to get one outside on 2 out of the 3 days we were there. We also enjoyed afternoon tea on the bar terrace watching the singing gondaliers and the hustle and bustle of the Grand Canal. We also enjoyed a romantic after dinner night cap every night on the same terrace which was just idyllic. This experience was enhanced by the warm, attentive and efficient service we received from Elvira who worked in the bar. The location for exploring Venice is perfect - away from the hustle and bustle of the St Marks and Rialto areas but under a 10 minute walk to both via the Accademia Bridge or one stop on the water bus to St Marks from Salute (which is right next door to the hotel) or a pleasant trip up the Grand Canal to Rialto from the same point. We only had one critism which was our room was located on the first floor overlooking the courtyard (which was lovely) but also above the service entrance so we did get awoken everyday just before 7.30am with noise and loud voices delivering laundry. Not a problem for early risers but we do prefer a lie in, especially as breakfast is served until 10.30am so that was little bit disapointing. Other than that we could not complain about anything and had the most wonderful time celebrating our 10th Anniversary. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else if we return to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Slapnmickle
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Marco Polo airport we asked about water taxi's to the hotel and were advised to take a private taxi (4 of us sharing), the cost is 120 euros and it took about 25 mins - well worth the money as it was exhilirating, we had our first view of Venice and the islands and the taxi pulled up at the front steps of the hotel. On arrival the doorman met us at the boat assisted us out of the boat and carried our luggage up to reception. We had a very warm welcome and were shortly shown to our rooms, the room was quite large and had a bath at one end which was quite unusual. The room had everything we required for a comfortable stay including mini bar, bath robes and slippers and a good selection of toiletries. We found the room to be very quiet at night and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Breakfast is in the dining room and if you're lucky you can eat outside on the veranda however places are very limited, the choice was extensive and I would say that there is ample for any taste. We found the staff to be very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. The location of the hotel is in a quiet area although it does overlook Grand Canal which is busy with traffic 24 hours a day, the hotel is very well soundproofed and once doors are closed you cannot hear the traffic. We found sitting watching the water taxi's, gondola's, etc passing the hotel facsinating. Much of Venice can be explored on foot, certainly St Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge are within a very easy walk of the hotel and both are a must. We also hired a water taxi to give us a 1 hour tour, the hotel provides a concierge service and sorted this out for us also giving us advice about where we could go and what we should visit. The hotel restaurant is excellent and we dined there on our first evening, everything was well prepared, presented and extremely tasty - I would definately recommend eating here. We also ate out a couple of nights as there is so much choice, if you can book a table overlooking water but you will need to do this in advance - we tried walking out one evening to find somewhere to eat overlooking water and really struggled! We returned to the airport once again on a private water taxi, the driver was not hanging about and we had a very exhilirating ride back which completed out stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “stunning”
Reviews.Author: melissa1971
Reviews.Content: we have just had the absolute pleasure of 3 nights at the centurion palace. we arrived by private water taxi which was a fun way to start. as an architect i thoroughly appreciated the attention to detail at every point, and was instantly impressed as we were greeted at the water front. the reception was impressive and the staff friendly and warm. as we were shown our room, with 2 balconies over looking the canal, i was giggling with excitement. i thought it was beautiful. a stunning bath, plenty of space, and a truly sensational view. the breakfast room was another very beautiful space, with the option of dining on the deck which i loved - watching a gondala or 2 cruise by. the location was sensational, we walked all over venice, and found it to be very central yet quiet and a bit removed from the chaotic areas. the gym was adequate, with a gorgeous little window view, although i thought the late opening hour was a little strange seeing it is unattended. my only criticism would be about wifi, i am not sure why such a hotel wouldn't have unlimited wireless access for it's guests. all in all i loved it, thank you husband

Reviews.Title: “A dream location”
Reviews.Author: Thomas R
Reviews.Content: From the moment we looked out onto our two balconies over the grand canal we knew it was going to be special. We'd booked a junior superior suite but were happily surprised with an upgrade to a canal-facing room. The hotel is modern, spacious and never too overstated (even by Venetian standards). The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful and the service was always spot on. The Centurian Palace is easy enough to find, just around the corner from Salute stop on the Grand Canal. Entry is via the hotel's attractive courtyard and sets the scene perfectly. We stayed 8 nights and found it a perfect base from which to get around Venice. Our stay included breakfast which could be taken outside on the terrace overlooking the canal. The room was kept immaculately clean and was freshly prepared for us by the chambermaids each day. We will definitely stay here again on returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Jodie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March for my partners 30th birthday. We had a lovely stay. Unfortunately my bags were lost at the airport n arrival and the staff at the hotel were so helpful in making phone calls to track it down for us...whilst we were out sight seeing. The room was nice, but very small (even though I had up graded to a better room when I booked the break and the shower was in miss repair. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; does not really deserve its rating 5*L”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Bxl
Reviews.Content: Excellent, quiet location between the Guggenheim and the Punta della dogana, only a short gondola ride to the San Marco area. Having breakfast on the terrace on the grand canal was wonderful. Reception desk and dining room personnel were kind and helpful. While the room itself was ok, the room service was not: bins not emptied several days in a row, shampoo / shower gel bottles not replaced, a leaking sink... Sloppy! Certainly not what you are entitled to expect in a 5*L hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Things, Bad Things!”
Reviews.Author: Worlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights this week; the hotel has it's good and bad points. We were upgraded to room 401 (junior suite with dual aspect and fantastic view, so get it if you can) but the room was not ready so we had lunch, which was very good. After lunch the room was still not ready and unfortunately, one particular member of the reception staff dealt with us in a particularly unsympathetic and dismissive fashion. On occasions during our stay, this person and indeed one or two other members of the staff, displayed a degree of arrogance which was unattractive. The room was superficially nice but the bedside light did not work, the shower was mouldy, the television did not work, you needed to be a gymnast to get into the bath and the bed was on a pedestal which is not necessarily the best position for a night-time visit to the bathroom! On the other hand, the bed was comfortable, the linen of excellent quality and the room was always beautifully made up. So, the hotel is in a wonderful position on the quieter side of that part of the Grand Canal and the food was very good but there were certain aspects which did not measure up to 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jude M
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to recover from the exertions of exploring the beautiful city of Venice. Nothing too much trouble for the friendly helpful staff. Rooms luxurious and atmosphere perfect. Would recommend to anyone, cannot believe anyone could complain. Will be back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions were excellent...beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natlittle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Centurion Palace by private taxi so had no trouble finding it at all!! As a newly engaged couple (8minutes before arriving...) we were greeted by a friendly bell man who helped us out of the boat and took our luggage for us. Gushing with excitement at our arrival in Venice (setting the scene...newly engaged, sunny day, blue sky, 4 whole days and nights without our 3 children...) we bustled into reception and annouced our arrival. The reception staff were friendly and helpful but not as over-excited as we were! The rooms weren't ready as it was only midday so we sat in the modest courtyard and comsumed a Â£7.00 per cup cappuccino! First impressions...very clean, comfortable and contemporary. The Centurion Palace is perfectly located as it is set back from the histle and bustle of San Marco and has a wealth of shops and restaurants which aren't as over priced as the opposite side of the Grand Canal. For people who do decide to catch the water bus please don't be put off by the negative reviews regarding distance...it is literally over a tiny wooden bridge and then a further 100 yards to the back entrance of the hotel. No big deal! The room was clean and very comfortable. It was cleaned twice daily with fresh towels each time. Ok there were a couple of cosmetic issues like a massive crack on the bathroom room (plastic coated gold leaf) and the shower screen leaked over the floor but the bed was comfy, big TV, lots of space, perfectly quiet. The thing that really makes this hotel is the breakfast and the outside terrace. We sat out every morning and this truly made the stay in the hotel worth every penny. As far as 5* hotels go (rating is normally based on service, location and facilities) this was spot on and would go back tomorrow! There are far more expensive hotels you can stay in in Venice and I'm sure the floor wont get wet or have a crack on the floor but you will be many thousands of euros lighter! If you are normal working people like us a five star is a splurge then this is the hotel for you. If you are looking for perfection then perhaps you need Palazzina Grassi hotel... Also, don't expect to get a free upgrade or a canal view room. We found out that these rooms are the suites and there are no standard canal view rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Suz92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Centurion Palace for 4 nights at the end of July whilst in Venice. We spent a long time looking at reviews and trying to decide which hotel to choose and i'm pleased to say we were delighted with our choice. We arrived at Marco Polo airport and purchaced the Rolling Venice card along with a 3 day pass and return airport to Venice transfer on the ACTV. We had no problem finding the hotel. The vaporetto stop at the Santa Maria de Salute church is right beside the hotel. You cross a small wooden bridge and the hotel is just around the corner on the right. On arrival at our hotel we were given maps and local information by the staff and taken to our room on the first floor. Our room was beautiful, contemporary and immaculate. It had a gold leaf bathroom with robes and slippers, a large flat screen TV, very comfy bed and mini bar. We did not have a canal view room but that didnâ€™t bother us as we were only in the room to change and sleep. If you want a canal view room I suggest you book one as you cannot be guarenteed one on arrival if the hotel is busy. The hotel itself is beautiful with a lovely courtyard and luxurius interior. Breakfast was served in the dining room and also on the terrace over looking the Grand Canal. Every morning we were lucky to get an outside table. Breakfast was delicious with a choice of fresh juices, water, prosecco, tea, coffee etc. Food included fresh fruit, croissants, toast, cold meats, salmon, scrambled eggs, sausages, baconâ€¦.. Everyone should find something they like as theres a wide variety to choose from. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel other than at breakfast, but had a few drinks in the evenings. Drinks are expensive as you would expect for a 5* hotel, so look at the price list before you order, if this concerns you. The hotels location was perfect for us-across the canal from the crowded San Marco but only 1 vaporetto stop away so easily accessible. Its in the Dorsoduro district around the corner from the Peggy Gugenhiem museum with a variety of glass and craft shops in the streets nearby. My husband and I took a gondola ride on our last night which I highly recommend if you have some cash spare, You get to see all the narrow canals, buildings and houses off the main tourist areas. Gondolas are available outside the hotel and along the back streets. Staff in the hotel were pleasant, friendly and extremely helpful, providing suggestions of good local restaurants and places to visit as well as helping us with the vaporetto routes when visiting Murano etc. Nothing was ever too much trouble. They welcome you when you return and even remembered our room number so we didnâ€™t even have to tell them when asking for our key! The room was cleaned twice each day, and chocolate and a weather forecast for the following day were left on the pillow-a lovely touch! I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice as it is truly a 5*. I would like to say thank-you to all the hotel staff for making our stay in Venice a perfect and memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel at Five Star Location”
Reviews.Author: fultonferry
Reviews.Content: I picked this place because I don't think it's necessary to stay in a period-piece hotel just because I'm in Venice. I shy away from grand hotels that have a great lobby and service, but the rooms are horrible. The location of the Centurion is wonderful. It's in the quiet Dorsoduro neighborhood, just across the Grand Canal from the busy, touristy San Marco. No need to be concerned about being across the Grand Canal from major tourist sites as there is a vaporetto stop less than 5 minutes away and it's not even a 5 minute ride across. The hotel is easy walking distance to a few restaurants, the Peggy Guggenheim Collection, the Church of Santa Maria della Salute and even a small food market. The view of the Grand Canal from the front of the hotel, including from the restaurant/breakfast room, is spectacular. You can sit with a drink outside in the front of the hotel and watch canal life, or in the lovely courtyard. This is a great, quiet neighborhood to escape the crowds and noise and I had no noise or sleeping problem at the hotel. The doormen, restaurant staff and housekeeping are wonderful and friendly, and the breakfast is very good, whether or not included with your room. On the other hand, the front desk staff are somewhat condescending and cold. For instance, they don't look you in the face when speaking with you, or talk to you as if you're an imposition. I kept thinking I was in Paris. As for the hotel itself, I think that those who give it 5 stars stayed in canal facing rooms which made up for other shortcomings. I didn't mind staying in a room overlooking the rooftops of Venice, which was actually kind of romantic, but it didn't make up for the problems with the room. The room was very clean and the furniture was new and in good condition. There were scratches on the white painted floor, a poorly designed shower that left water -- actual puddles -- everywhere in the bathroom because water didn't drain properly, the shower knob came off, water splashes from the bathroom sink onto the floor -- could this be a hotel theme because it's Venice? -- a very slippery shower stall with no bath mat, and an old shower head that should have been replaced. In addition, the guest services literature left in the room was creased and old, one light wasn't working over the bed, the air could only be controlled by the front desk, so if you wanted to turn it off or lower it, you had to notify them. I passed hefty bags and cleaning supplies in the hallway on the way to the room. If i were paying less and the bathroom problems were fixed, this would be an ok place to stay, but only if you can get a really great deal and/or a better room than I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and thats it!”
Reviews.Author: kidfree
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! The room was tiny, the people that work here were fine but not very helpful, the bathroom is tiny and the breakfast just okay. We came here after a wonderful Seabourn cruise and a great stay in Athens at the King George Palace. We thought we would continue our great vacation. But this is NOT a five star hotel. I rarely write negative reviews because usually I rely on TA and other sources to choose wisely and mange my expectations. But this was not what I thought. I am glad that we were ableto use miles to pay for the room because it is not worth the price. I would not stay here again nor would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view with a fantastic room to relax in after a long day of touring.”
Reviews.Author: barbmoran
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing view of the Grand Canal! Our room was spacious with a large bathroom and excersie room. The bed was extremely comfortable, which a must after all of the walking you do! The staff was very helpful in recommending great places for dinner and taking care of your needs. You can not go wrong staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Venitian Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gato4
Reviews.Content: Located ideally on the Grand Canal not far from Piazza San Marco, this is a beautiful friendly hotel. The location is convenient, and plenty active, yet quite. The historical building retains its character while providing elegant, modern rooms - many of which offer great views of the city and Grand Canal. It is entertainment in itself to watch the activity on the canal from the balcony or the restaurant terrace. The staff are efficient and helpful. We spent 4 nights with our 12 year old son and found it to be entirely family friendly while exuding all the charm and romance that would be expected of Venice. It is also priced well below other better known luxury properties.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Potter4
Reviews.Content: Spent a fantastic weekend at the Centurion Palace, Our rooms were on the 6th floor and looked out onto the Grand Canal, rooms were modern, clean and bed very comfortable, breakfast was simple but very nice, especially the scrambled egg. Hotel opposite side of canal from St Mark's Square, which was nice cos you could get away from the tourist areas. I would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel and 5* Service - We loved it”
Reviews.Author: PWHarris
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is furnished to the highest standards and very modern with a great position on the Grand Canal overlooking St Marks Square. All the staff are welcoming and very helpful and they try and do everything to ensure you have a great holiday with them,nothing is too much trouble. The views from the waterside are breathtaking,sit there,have a drink and relax and watch Venice flow past you! Our room was superb,a balcony that you can sit on,unlike most expensive hotels in Venice where its standing room only if your lucky!!!,great facilities,we had a gold bathroom and wet room-fantastic. Breakfast was a very good hot & cold buffet with very attentive and happy staff who made the start of the day pleasurable. A big thanks to all the staff at the Centurion Palace you made our trip memorable,thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, Romantic, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KentJCampbell
Reviews.Content: Right on the Grand Canal, view of St. Marks, excellent service and perfect location. Our balcony overlooked the canal - we felt like royalty. We'd spontaneously wave at people in slow-motion as if we were someone important. Our two kids thought we were in the hotel The Tourist was filmed in because the room is so alike and the view is almost exactly the same (not the same location though, I understand it wasn't filmed in a hotel, but at a building a bit further down the canal). For us it was the perfect transition to our cruise from Venice (Seaborne Spirit - also very highly recommended).

Reviews.Title: “Pure indulgence, outstanding service and magical location”
Reviews.Author: NZ_SandS
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Venice mid July - not realising just how popular a time of year it would prove to be tourist wise - we were relieved to check into the serene, calm and very indulgent Centurion Palace. Positioned right on the Grand Canal with fabulous views, the main entrance is hidden down a gorgeous walkway ....one minute from a very regularly serviced waterbus terminal. We must have commented at least five times a day how grateful we were for the hotels location ... away from the crowds yet in the most perfect location. Our room (110) could not have been better. We were a little dissapointed not to have scored a canal view but in hindsight were grateful for the cool, quiet courtyard view in the end. High ceilings, stunning interior design, gorgeous linens, outstanding housekeeping and all the little touches you expect from a five star hotel. Whilst the architecture of the building, luxurious interiors, commanding position and AMAZING breakfast buffet (with terrace tables right on the canal) are worth mentioning, the real difference is the staff. How refreshing to see the same faces everyday. Be remembered, warmly welcomed 'home' after a long hot day and given your room key without having to mention the room number or never having to sign for anything. Its little touches like that which make this truly five star ...including the prompt delivery of a chilled glass of milk at 11pm when I coudlnt sleep! Did I mention the chocolate dipped strawberries and prosecco on arrival? All this indulgence, three nights (including breakfast) for a very reasonable 800 Euro. We're well travelled and rely heavily on Tripadvisor for recommendations. If this hotel (check out their special deals via SLH website and register as a member) is in your price range ....book yourself in. You will NOT regret it!

Reviews.Title: “This certainly is not a five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RogerPilard
Reviews.Content: Although my wife and I are travelling a lot and weâ€™re always staying in high end hotels /resorts I rarely write such reviews, but felt compelled to so do with the hope that other like-minded travellers might benefit from my experience. Our trip dates back to Mid - April .We stayed there for 2 nights in a junior suite. Price for 2 nights B&B = Euro 1376 / USD 2000. Overall impression. The 2010 opened Centurion is perfectly positioned on the Grand Canal/diagonally across from San Marco mercifully tucked away from ground zero of tourist mayhem. The design is modern but materials look a bit cheap upon closer examination. Breakfast is ok but far away from 5 stars However, the service was good. Welcoming was nice but after 2 minutes we were offered to join a so called â€œfree tripâ€� to Murano which refers to nothing else than a hard selling promotion tour, a 5 star hotel should never offer to its guests. As for the roomâ€¦.. The junior suite we got was in fact a double room with a separated saloon. Our bathroom was lined in gold leaf which already was â€œdeterioratingâ€� and showing clear sign of abrasion.. Amenities not worth to mention. The shower which already showed clear signs of mould was located behind the mirror and you had to climb three steps to get in (and in particular out) which we considered a totally needless and dangerous feature. First impression for a two year old hotel: not well looked after! The suite itself was - let me put it diplomatically - poorly cleaned! I directly stepped into dried contact lenses, there were black hairs on the white floor as well as red wine spots andâ€¦obviously a blood spot on one of my cushions which was rather DISGUSTING. I complained about all this to the respective manager whereupon he followed me upstairs in order to investigate my "findings". He expressed his apologies and the room was cleaned! So, it should not happen once, things are not running smoothly but it must not happen twice. Next day, the room which we left at 10amâ€¦ wasn't ready at 4pm!!!! So I had to complain again and now got some excuses that the hotel had problems with the room cleaning staff and was told one of them was suspended and so onâ€¦etc. We were offered compensation in form of a dinner or boat transfer back to the airport but had to refuse the offer due to the fact we were otherwise occupied (tax and rest.bookings were made in advance months ago) and of course we were absolutely not willing to gather additional â€œexperiencesâ€�. In a nutshell: This certainly is not a five star hotel. And to be honest...it doesn't help much if the management responses on those testimonials by expressing its deepest regrets, promising the service will be satisfying next time instead of improving things. Would you ever stay again? Guess what,â€¦.! "Pay a lot, expect a lot.â€œ. might be a helpful initial starting point for the management to reconsider guests needs in order to manage their expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated 5* on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeThompson
Reviews.Content: The Centurion is in the best position, opposite the Gritti Palace over looking the most scenic part of the Grand Canal. Located in the quieter 'arty' neighbourhood of Dorsoduro away from the hustle and bustle of San Marco, and yet just one vapretto stop or a short stroll across the Accademia bridge. The service is 5* - dining is on a beautiful terrace overlooking the Grand Canal, with a serene a comfortable walled courtyard for quiter moments. The inside decor is ultra modern, while the exterior is classical Venetian Palace. The only disappointment was the size of our Superior room, very small, but beautifully decorated, with only tiny windows in the roof, so no view or opportunity to open the window, if your budget allows go for one of the suites with views over the Grand Canal or the garden courtyard. Small gym if you feel inclined! Breakfast was good, continental options plus cooked breakfast, lunch and diner menu, good quality Italian dishes.... ice cream, salads and small plates available on the bar terrace until the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “great location, with a superb bar for drinks overlooking the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: annafromuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lovely location, although gothic and cute from the outside, the inside is contemporary. Breakfast was overlooking the Grand Canal. There was also a small seating area outside overlooking the grand canal which was great for a coffee or for a drink in the evening. There were no in room tea/coffee making facilities, but the view from the bar area was so nice, we sat and watched the boats go by. The staff were all very attentive, eager to help and spoke very good english. Our room overlooked a quiet coutyard, had an ensuite shower (no bath) & some nice modern touches (although the electronics had a 'heartbeat' light which flashed throughout the night). We had a couple of issues with the bathroom - the first day we had to get someone to show us how to work the shower & the toilet went from flushing continually to not flushing at all (but was resolved by changing rooms for our last night, although I prefered our original room as it was quieter - but a working bathroom was a priority!) The Centurion Palace was in a great bit of Venice - comparatively peaceful, near Salute & the Guggenheim, and a short walk from the San Marco district.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Rooms, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: wildwestNWT
Reviews.Content: A wonderful combination of gothic and contemporary wow. While very elegant, it was comfortable and the service met our every need, from the basic questions answered to booking tickets at the last minute. It's well located on the Grande Canal but in a neighbourhood that still seems to maintain venetian ways. It was also a treat that they upgraded us to a room facing the Grande Canal, in what is likely the most eclectic and luxurious suites we have ever stayed in - James Bond comes to mind. We have no complaints and would choose this hotel again for its charm and offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: BLS_65
Reviews.Content: An elegant "Great Dane" located on the Grand Canal - Dorsoduro district directly across from the Gritti Palazzo. This magnificently restored Venetian-Gothic facade discreetly hides it stylishly and respectful contemporary designed interior. This gorgeous Palazzo will offer you an elegant and relaxing sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of this extremely popular destination. From the moment we arrived, we knew that this was going to be an exquisite Hotel to spend (7) nights. The gracious personnel were extremely accommodating to our requests and provided us with useful information regarding restaurants that made our visit memorable. We loved Barbara â€“ Iâ€™m sorry it has taken this long to write this Review, but we havenâ€™t stopped recommending this lovely place. After beating the pavement all day; our daily ritual was to watch the sunset on the Grand Canal sipping a delightful bottle of Pinto Grigio on their terrace. We selected this wine on the first evening and were pleasantly surprised to have the same wine promptly delivered with a bucket of ice upon our arrival every evening for the balance of our trip. What a simple, but well appreciated gesture. Our amazing room was located on the second floor facing the interior courtyard. The king size bed was extremely comfortable and the gold leaf bathroom was a charming touch. The first evening was perfect, but we were slightly disappointed to return the following evening to our Hotel to find scaffolding installed in front of room window for (4) nights. The hotel was clearly undergoing major maintenance issues, so we were puzzled why we offered this room for our stay (or) not even compensated for this visual obstruction, ghastly smell and annoying construction noise. The other item that bothered us was â€œWhy would a Hotel of this calibre charge for wi-fi?â€� If you are planning to visit Venice, then you should definitely splurge on this gorgeous Palazzo since the majority of the Hotels in Venice are overpriced and they will probably disappoint you. This is an expensive city that requires substantial funds to fully appreciate this unique city. Dorsoduro There are several districts in Venice with San Marco being the most popular, but the Dorsoduro is the most elegant, peaceful and centrally located. Your ultimate destination area will provide with ample visual and cultural stimulation, such as the Accademia Gallery, the Peggy Guggenheim Museum of Modern Art, Palazzo Grassi (Francois Pinault), Ca'Rezzonico, Scuola dei Carmini, Galleria Cini and religious structures such as Santa Maria della Salute, San Sebastiano, San Nicolo Mendicoli,, San Trovaso, and along the Fondamenta delle Zattere, I Gesuati and Santa Maria della Visitazione, but the â€œWater Taxisâ€� or Vaporetto will whisk you quickly to the adjacent islands.

Reviews.Title: “Well located venetian gothic revival architectural gem.”
Reviews.Author: helenemsley1961
Reviews.Content: Whether you reach the Centurion Palace by motoscafi to their private quay or arrive on foot, through Venice`'s myriad streets and bridges, don't forget to look up, or you'll miss the splendid facade of the Santa Maria della Salute. We arrived slap in the middle of a Press lunch for journalists promoting the latest exhibition at a nearby gallery. No matter, we were given the most solicitous welcome. Twelve of us were checked in with the smoothness of a well-oiled machine, my daughter and niece's room wasn't ready, so they were given an up-grade, to a room with a terrace, which one of our party described as being "size of a small african country"! I had trouble enticing them out of the hotel. So you see, we were already satisfied customers. This hotel is in a fabulous location on the Dorsorduro, a 2 minute walk to the Guggenheim and Accademia gallery, far enough from San Marco to avoid the hoards, yet in easy walking/traghetto distance if you want to mingle and listen to the orchestra at Florian. Interiors are contemporary yet hark back to the original architectural features you would expect from 19th century gothic revival. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Un paradiso - simply benissimo”
Reviews.Author: Swissness70
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor-users I booked a superior room and what should I say ... it WAS superior! I got a beautiful room in the attic! First I was a little shocked about the openspace-bathtube ... but was soon relieved when I found the separate shower/toilet. I loved the mix between cosy wooden beams and the modern equipments. The room was not orriented to the Canale Grande - which I appreciated because on the other side of the building you can enjoy peaceful silence. Nevertheless I had a wonderful view over the rooftops to beautiful church, chiesa del redentore! The hotel is beautiful located in a very elegant and peaceful neighbourhood, in walking distance you will find all the great sights to visite. The hotel has a wonderful court yard where you can enjoy a nice espresso or a glass of wine. Breakfast is wonderful and the staff is very attentive and friendly! The restaurant Antinoo's is highly recommended - good food, friendly staff! This Hotel is really top and I hope it will stay at this level.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: Beeret1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Centurion Palace for 3 nights in April costing just under â‚¬1000. The hotel is in a great location and is easily accessible from the airport without having to lug cases through the city to get to it. Our room was on the top floor looking out on the canal although given the rooms are built into the loft/attic - this view is not quite as I expected. The room was nice, but didn't meet my expectations having looked at the pictures on the website. The buffet breakfast had ample choice was we enjoyed it each morning. The staff were friendly & helpful. Overall a hotel I would happily recommend but a little too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Modern elegance in an ancient city”
Reviews.Author: DFig
Reviews.Content: wonderful stay here at the opening of the grand canal. The staff was amazing and arranged for several events for us. This hotel is across from the main island, so be prepared to walk or grab a gondola - but it's worth it, the views are exceptional and it is the best value in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular ambience”
Reviews.Author: Family_Bjorkman
Reviews.Content: - If arriving to Venice airport, take the water-taxi option (13 euros each), takes 1 hour and it lands at Zarette, approx 15min walk from the hotel - Arriving in boat straight to the hotel dock is of course extraordinary but very expensive - We stayed one night, booked via SHL.com (members). We booked a decent room but clearly got an astonishing upgrade (room 502). It is a 2 floor apartment, with grand views of the Canale and the next-door church. Stunning! - Classy modern style, fashionable yet cosy furniture - Golden bathroom is perhaps a bit too Italian but what the heck, it was pretty cool - The nearby 600 year old Church is so close to your window (viewpoint from bed for example) that you think you could reach out to it - 2 flatscreeen tv - Nice products in bathroom but here is an opportunity to develop even more - On the 2nd floor in our room/apartment, under exceptional wooden ceiling (could it be 200-300 years old?), you have a great bed and then next to it a huge modern bathtub, prepped with extra towels and everything for a romantic evening - At arrival, we had strawberries with chocolate (no extra charge) waiting for us - Ipod docking station - Financial times etc every morning - We had to leave early morning - of course they prepared breakfast boxes for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaunster
Reviews.Content: We really loved the centurion palace and would highly recommend it. The best bits: 1. We booked a return water taxi in advance and had a seamless (albeit high speed!) transfer right to and from the small pontoon at the front of the hotel. No need to lump cases around the small streets. 2. The hotel is decorated in a very contemporary way but the mix of old and new really works well. 3. All of the staff were extremely friendly and keen to help. 4. Our room was lovely, small but perfectly formed. We had two small windows with views over the grand canal where we spent much time watching the world go by. 5. We loved the location, quiet but right opposite san marco piazza which was easily accessed, and with some lovely small shops and restaurants close by. 6. The hotel restaurant was excellent, especially for the included breakfast. Areas for improvement: As with most higher class hotels , food and drink (including the mini bar) was very expensive - as an example 16 euros in the lounge for a beer and a bottle of water. I ordered a bottle of champagne in advance of our arrival (for my Wife's birthday) and was amazed when this was delivered to our room to be told by the member of staff that this was complimentary. I checked twice and there was even a little handwritten note saying "with our compliments". What an amazing touch we thought.and I even went to reception to thank them. However, it seems this was a mistake by the bar staff and the champagne was charged to my account. I have no quibble with paying as at the end of the day I ordered the champagne, it was disappointing though that the information given was incorrect. And finally, at the restaurant on our first night I asked for a bottle of Barolo. When the wine came it was actually Brunello (obviously my poor Italian). I decided to go with this as I had not tried it before, but got a real surprise at the end of the meal to find that the wine was 140 euros. I put this down to experience but the fact that you can buy the wine in the UK (imported from Italy) for 30 euros shows the massive mark up added by the hotel. Overall we loved our trip to Venice and will definitely use the Centurion Palace again despite these minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! A true 5*”
Reviews.Author: Margot1960
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, via private water taxi (well worth the â‚¬100), we were very well looked after. We booked a superior room - 406 - (with Grand Canal view), it was well appointed, if compact. The bathroom (shower only) looked amazing, but ... unfortunately on our first morning the shower cascaded across the floor, soaking everything. However, the receptionist redeemed the hotel by swiftly moving us into a junior suite - 402- on the same floor. Huge room, fab bathroom & 15ft high windows with panoramic views of the Grand Canal. Breakfast is excellent - a huge selection of hot and cold dishes, fresh fruit, pastries, good coffee and Prosecco too. The waiting staff were charming and attentive. If you take the treghetto (50 cent gondola that ferries you across the Grand Canal - unless it's raining!), two minutes from the hotel, you can walk to St Mark's Square in 5 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel, great location, staff and building.

Reviews.Title: “a million stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: slovene
Reviews.Content: the first thing when we arrived, the receptionist said: you donÂ´t have a nice room, you have a beautiful room with a canal grande view.... but room 211 is not just beautiful!! it is amazing, superb, beyond all expectations! all in all, it was a real dreamy stay and an unforgettable anniversary! thank you

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to excite and soothe the senses”
Reviews.Author: glf2010
Reviews.Content: The Centurion Palace Hotel added to our enjoyment of Venice, a beautiful and magical city full of wonder and history. Located on the Grand Canal, the main lifeline of Venice, the hotel evokes the past era of grandeur as its facade is typical of 14th and 15th century venetian "palazzos". However, the interior has been completely renovated to excite the senses with modern and original artifacts. Our room, facing the canal, was welcoming with its chic decor and the bathroom opulent with its gilded interior. The personnel was welcoming and very helpful with all our requests. The copious and delicious varieties of foods at breakfast was only enhanced by the friendly staff who were only too happy to make our stay a most enjoyable one. The hotel is conveniently located close to museums, shops and St. Mark's Square. Ask about the use of the Traghetto close to the hotel which is a gondola ride crossing the Grand Canal and costing approx. 75 cents. Our wonderful experience in Venice was definitely enhanced by our stay at the Centurion Palace hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: WonderousTraveler
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, our stay at Centurion Palace was truly magical. The staff was incredibly pleasant, attentive and made sure to take of every single detail - even finding a local hairstylist last minute. Our room was a perfect blend of modern with classic overlooking the Grand Canal. The hotel's restaurant was a very special treat. We had the chef's tasting and he prepared every dish to perfection. We are both in the industry and know how difficult this can be. We highly recommend this hotel for its location, beauty, modern touches while respecting historical value, service and food. We look forward to our return. Thank you for a magical stay.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Maastrichtmom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and it was incredibly expensive. The location is great - on the Grand Canal. The bathroom was so "hi tech" that is was impossible to use the shower. We too had problems with a lack of hot water. The room was unbelievably hot and when I called the front desk 3 times to complain I was told that the thermostat is controlled by computer and the heat could not be lowered. I was escorted by a woman from the front desk to the wrong side of the hotel when showing me to my room and had to go back outside to actually find the correct elevator. We paid over 1000 Euros for the 2 nights and then were charged extra for internet access. A

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but VERY dependent on your room allocation!”
Reviews.Author: glennharrold
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Centurion Palace as part of a trip to Italy. After reading some previous review we had some concerns, however on arrival were pleasantly surprised finding the rooms contemporarily decorated and comfortable. Our first room, with its own roof terrace, was small but very comfortable initially. On the first night the temperature in the room (309) exceeded 28 degrees as the air con was not operational and as a result we did not get any sleep at all - the windows did open but pigeons flocked towards the windowsills and the external noise was problematic also. On complaining about this we were moved to room 201 for the remainder of our stay - overlooking the Grand Canal. This room was spacious, comfortable, trendy and impressive both in terms of view but also comfort. Staff were helpful and courteous. The hotel is located a good walk from some of the attractions but ideal for exploring the city, with water bus stops very close by if you want to take a 2 minute ride across the canal to St Marks Square etc. Breakfast was included and was simple and tasty. served in the Grand Canal side dining room. Overall, it is an aspiring 5 star hotel - its not quite there yet - but a comfortable, contemporary 4 star accommodation in a good location with great staff. I'd stay again if I got a good deal online and could guarantee a good room.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Luxury Sceenaâ€™ (SINA)”
Reviews.Author: columbuscirclenyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet corner of the Dosoduro district near the Peggy Guggenheim and the new contemporary art museum in the old customs house. Our duplex canal-view suite (it was the honeymoon, we went crazy) at 760euro/$1,000+ a night looked great when we checked in, but then the unreliable hot water, mold in the â€œdeath trapâ€� shower, broken TV set, â€œHoliday Innâ€� amenities and an upstairs bed and a long walk downstairs to the bathroom, turned a luxury suite into a disappointment. The â€œgymâ€� was a few machines stuck in the attic. There was an additional charge for the internet. The staff at the ample breakfast couldnâ€™t have been nicer, but the very poorly-informed and sometimes lackadaisical and other times inexperienced front desk staff did send us off on one great find (a terrific English speaking tour guide Mrs Bastianello who grew up in the Cannaregio district) but several misadventures (wrong address for a terrible local district restaurant in the pouring rain, strong recommendations for a tourist trap restaurant near San Marco square ($60 pasta dishes), informing us that a museum was closed that we luckily stumbled across and found open, being sent off on a â€œfree tourâ€� of Murano to be pressured into buying 4500 Euro vases). All and all, an average hotel promoting the word â€œluxuryâ€� but not delivering.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: marikirby
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights last week before our trip down the Adriatic Coast and loved every minute of it! The location is perfect, at the end of the Grand Canal right across the canal from the Gritti Palace. We booked the superior room with free breakfast. Breakfast was a great selection of meats, cheeses, eggs, fruit, and even champagne! We sat outside overlooking the canal both mornings. The bar was open late even during the week which allowed us to have a nice cocktail after spending the night walking the streets of Venice. The staff treated us like VIPs, great service as they were easily accessible and knowledgeable in offering best ways to squeeze a weeks worth of Venice into 2 days. We had a wonderful experience and would refer them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Josephine B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Centurion, the lady at the desk said : This room and the view is the best of Venice". She was right. After a 4 night stay at the Centurion I'm sure we had the best hotel in Venice. If by any chance you can have room 401, you"ll see that it's really amazing. Perfect location in Dorsoduro right between FranÃ§ois Pinault and Peggy Guggenheim art museums and very easy to cross to San Marco with a 1 euro gondola ride that crosses the Grand Canal. Absolutely everyone at the Centurion is nice and helpful. All restaurants recommandations were great. The ladies at the breakfast room were all smiles and tending to all our needs. Be sure to find the time to go to Murano et Burano which are 2 incredible islands. The hotel offers a free ride in a beautiful private boat. We will be back in Venice and certainly at the Centurion Palace

Reviews.Title: “Nice mix of old and new in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TBAR_ATL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Centurion for 2 nights. Got a great deal, even in the height of the summer tourist season. The Centurion is a former palace that has been turned into a hotel. The location at the southern part of the grand canal, across from the more touristy part of the city, made it a much more relaxing place to stay. And it's only a 10 minute walk from St. Mark's square because it's right near one of the 3 bridges that cross the Grand Canal. It's also right near a vaporetto stop and next to the wonderful Peggy Guggenheim art museum. The rooms were contemporary with nice bathrooms and ammenities. A breakfast buffet with good quality and variety was included with my room. The only problem I had were these modern, touch on/off reading lights that went on by themselves in the middle of the night. The managment told me they were in the midst of replacing them, and took care of my bar bill to compensate. Overall, a recommended alternative to the traditional Venice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tip top lux, wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: DannyDollars
Reviews.Content: Loved the Centurion, was there with partner for one night before joining a cruise. The hotels is modern, quirky with bags of class. Quite glam in places and rather understated in others - nice balance. Very cool to arrive by taxi on it's private jetty, and sitting right on the river for late night cocktails then for breakfast is a must. Found the room a little small but loved the decor (gold leaf 'everything' in the bathroom, fab!) It's on the quieter side and is a bit of a walk if youi dont want to wait for the river bus but I would def recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Hoff-dk
Reviews.Content: Location perfect: There's no need for anything else than public transport if you're coming from the Marco Polo. Public and cheap express bus goes to Venice and from there you can take the Vaporetto directly to the hotel (Stop: Salute) right next to the hotel. Rooms: Great. Our room had it's own roof terrace. Breakfast: Perfect! Price: Venice is expensive and so is this hotel, but compared to other hotels with the same standard, it's definitely OK

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: archie886332
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Centurion for one night only. The location of the hotel is perfect and the interiors beautiful. The choice at breakfast was excellent. One of us was ill on the day we were due to leave and the hotel very kindly allowed us to stay in the room until departing that evening without charge. Everyone at the reception was particularly helpful and we will definitely stay there again at some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, unforgettable view, great service!”
Reviews.Author: lilfoodiegirl
Reviews.Content: What an introduction to Venice! Water taxi delivered us right to the door and the doormen were right there to greet us! They gave us a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful room. The gold bathroom was a hoot, and yes, the shower overflowed into the bathroom, but one quick call downstairs and the problem was fixed! Yes, the bed was on a platform, but you'd have to be incapacitated not to be able to get in and out of the quite wide step. And yes, there is internet, you have to buy 3 euro cards from the front desk. We slept like babies with the sound of the water outside the window and the view was magnificent. The room was elegantly furnished, in gold and red, true Venetian decor. Breakfast was delicious and on good weather days, we ate on the patio over the water. I've dreamt that I was sleeping in that room almost every night since we got back. What a glorious memory!

Reviews.Title: “Some people are hard to please arent...”
Reviews.Author: jp0036
Reviews.Content: Some people are hard to please arent they, my advice dont travel, then you won't be disappointed.Phew feel better now , anyway just got back from a two night stay at this hotel , which is fab by the way , great location , really friendly staff , we paid 230 sterling a night , we emailed ahead, and they upgraded us free to a room facing the canal , it was lovely, exposed beams , lush bedding, robes , slippers, gold leaf bathroom with rainfall shower, big enough for two, (ooh err). The breakfast rooms are wonderful with terraces over the Grand Canal, breakfast was to die for , you can have 5 courses if you want including smoked salmon and Prosecco, bacon etc. The staff even allowed us to take more coffee and wine out onto the terrace. I have read that staff in Venice hotels are rude and cant be bothered, totally not the case here, all were charming and helpful, sure the bar prices are very steep which is a real shame because we would have spent all day and night on the bar terrace if we could have afforded to, this may explain why the bar was quiet ,all in all great modern hotel in,a great location, 5 star luxury but without the stuffiness, if you want that pay 200 quid a night more for a room in a more traditional Venice 5 star hotel ( no doubt facing an extractor fan) . Looking at this hotel it does give you that feeling of being exclusive, where people in the know stay - type feeling. I would recommend this to anyone who allows themselves to enjoy trips away , you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Writing a poor review is not easy”
Reviews.Author: kendall
Reviews.Content: It has taken us over six months to write this review; my wife and I seldom write negative comments, as we understand how difficult and complicated running a hotel can be. Since this was a brand new hotel- we were aware that it needed some time to adjust. After reading the latest reviews, we feel that we were not alone in our first observations. This trip, we decided to stay at three different hotels along the Grand Canal.. We had been watching the renovation of this building for what seemed years - while having lunch at the Gritti Palace across the canal. We were quite surprised by the interior - as the hotel was designed in a very modern decor- obviously done by some well-known designer. We were up-graded to a suite on the Grand Canal- with two balconies... a perfect location. Unfortunately, the choice of materials and "modern " style was a bit off-putting, not because we love traditional surroundings- as we are in the design field ourselves- but nothing made any sense! The flooring was light -made from some synthetic material, which was already showing dirt. The room, painted very dark, seemed crowded- the platform bed was a disaster for anyone over 30- especially when they put out the bed rugs. The bathroom was ridiculous- poorly designed, lined in gold leaf that already was deteriorating. Almost none of the lighting worked ;the only thing that did were the automated curtains... We felt as if we could have been in any hotel in New York City.... Besides the unfortunate design, the service was equally poor. We had to wait for hours before our luggage made it upstairs- we asked for ice and had to call down to the desk numerous times to receive it. The young lady who escorted us to our room was very off-putting in her manner- the one exception was the young man at the front desk. The fresh flowers we brought with us were left in a vase without water! This certainly did not feel like a five star hotel. We do know all of these issues can be resolved, but in the end, it is still a large- overblown hotel, lacking any warmth or relationship to its location. I guess waiting six months to write did not temper our initial response to give the Centurion a negative review.

Reviews.Title: “overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: beenthere76
Reviews.Content: The room size was barely adequate with a dangerous step up to the bed. The bathroom was adequate but the shower was a disaster, the doors would not close properly, causing rivers of water on the floor and the showerhead needed to be hand held to obtain an overall dousing. The breakfast was good for fruit lovers but the scrambled egg was cold every day for 4 days. However, the service at breakfast was good. Took one evening meal in the hotel and was extremely disappointed with the lack of choice for both the entree and the desert and there were no vegetables served either with the entree or as a side dish or extra. The situation of the hotel suited us as we enjoy walking and did not have a problem with the location but anyone less fit or mobile could find this an issue if they wanted to spend time in the S.Marco area. Overall, this is not a 5star hotel by international standards.

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters is not gold”
Reviews.Author: RichardOwen49
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful building, unfortunately the interior is very modern, nothing wrong with that but it seems like all the effort has gone into looks and not whether things work. The first room we had, had a rainfall shower but the drain( a narrow gap close to the floor) was blocked so the bathroom flooded.
