We complained and were 'upgraded' to a junior suite, this time the shower was in a cubicle but the door didn't fit and the bathroom flooded again. When we told the receptionist just smiled and shrugged his shoulders. The junior suite was a duplex, so the bed was up a flight of stairs, amongst the rafters of the hotel. Unfortunately the rafters were also the home of Mosquitos, my wife and I left with at least 50 bites. When we checked in we were just showed to our room, when we checked out the couple in front of us (who were checking in) were asked whether they had been to Venice before, when they said 'no' the receptionist produced a map and talked the couple through all sorts of details, e.g. where to catch the river taxi from, times it ran, what to do if they missed the last boat, where the shopping areas were, places of interest etc. We got none of this, we were walking round Venice almost blind. My wife and I are fortunate enough to travel extensively, and this is the first 5* hotel we have stopped in that doesn't even offer complimentary bottles of drinking water in the room. I'm afraid that this Hotel does not come up to the required standard to have a 5* rating. One last point, although nothing to with the hotel is that Venice was a disappointment, we expected high prices, but many of the buildings are covered in graffiti and the place is littered with cigarette ends. Venice needs a good polish! Incidentally,we travelled with Expedia and have logged the same review with them, surprisingly they have chosen not to publish it. Read into that what you will.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location & modern/cool rooms”
Reviews.Author: CairoLATravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and loved it. They said they gave us an upgrade but it seemed just like a normal room (no view of the canal). The location is awesome-right on the Grand Canal by the Peggy Guggenheim museum. There's a water vaparetto stop right by it which is super convenient. The hotel inside is very modern & updated. Our room was very nice, clean & the bathroom was cool-all gold inside. However, the shower was kind of annoying because it's not fully enclosed and we kept getting water all over the bathroom floors. The service was great-they were nice helping us with any questions we had. The breakfast is also amazing. A huge spread of pastries, juices, fruit, meats, salmon, eggs etc etc etc. I would definitely stay here again & I would definitely suggest it to my friends who visit Venice :)

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!! best hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Monkema
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic, the staff is wonderful, the location could not be any better. The rooms are enormous. I would love to come back to Centurion Palace, they have made my holiday. Recomendations: Book the water taxi from the hotel to the airport, 100 euros, not cheap but worth it, its an experience in itself. Great restaurant : A Beccafico at Academia, superb food, very good staff, and well priced for Venice for the quality you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel....very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WendyandRichard
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our recent stay at the Centurion Palace. Traditional facade but inside the hotel has been totally modernised, it is cheap and tasteless and no thought to practical use inside the very small hotel bedrooms. The walls are lined with silk paper but the finish on everything else is cheap and nasty. I wanted an iron and ironing board but was told it was a health and safety issue to use one in my room, obviously due to all the combustable furnishings and /or tactics to use the very expensive laundry service. The staff were ar best unfriendly and worst arrogant and surly. The service was hit and miss and not to a 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Modern yet Comfortable, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DSB43
Reviews.Content: Modern styling differentiates this small hotel from other luxury hotels in Venice. Warm colors used throughout the hotel, beds are plush, couches and chairs perfect (design and functionality--go figure!). Location great--very close to St. Marco square (one stop on the "boat bus"), but on the other side of the Canal, so away from the noise and crowds. Hearty breakfast. Travelled with ten people, all raved about hotel and staff/service. Very friendly staff who are proud of their new hotel. Great choice of rooms in hotel--I stayed in a two level, 1 bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if this is worth 5stars!!!!”
Reviews.Author: damo66BurgessHill
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Centurion Palace and not sure if it was worth the ratings.I booked through expedia into the Superior Double Room.Initially on arrival the room looked great,nice size,good bed,good t.v.,Ipod docking station,mini bar, good lighting.It was the bathroom that was the let down.There was no bath,the decor was a garish gold colour.It had a nice sink and the shower with lights in the floor was just a show piece.Dont touch the mini bar,ive stayed in hotels around the world and paid some mini bar bills but this was ridiculous.One can of coke and two small mineral waters 19euros.There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room.There is no use of irons for guests,only an expensive laundry service.The breakfast was good.though. i saw not one guest eat a restaurant evening meal or use the bar.the location was good but im not sure i would recommend this hotel.And as has happened with expedia booked hotels before you dont seem to get the best rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with 1 problem”
Reviews.Author: doogles21
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent hotel its like the future the elevator is like a time machine and the hotel room is 2 levels (never seen that before!!!!) The only problem was at night the hotel smelled like suage. The wi-fi there is really cheap and is well worth it 3 Euros for 1 Hour and 5 Euros for 5 hours

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few teething problems”
Reviews.Author: OzTravelAddict
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Centurion Palace for 2 nights with our 7 year old daughter at the end of June. We decided to splash out on a suite with Grand Canal view and a separate standard room for our daughter, booked through the SINA hotels website at the introductory rate. I had called to check the two rooms would be close to each other, and was assured that they would be 'face to face'. When we arrived by water taxi from the airport, I was slightly disappointed to see that the hotel was clearly undergoing maintenance - the manhole cover in the courtyard was up, with hazard barriers around it, and there was an alarming smell of sewage. Workmen had erected a workbench in the corner of the courtyard and were busy sawing up pipes with a circular saw (rather noisy!). In the passageway to the restaurant, the bar was covered in clear plastic as there was clearly work in that area too. Not a great way to start, though the reception staff were very welcoming and the reception area is stunning. We were then shown to our rooms on the fourth floor Again, the maintenance issues were very clear, as there was a bucket on the floor by the lift and the skirting board of the passageway had been removed - we asked what the problem was and were told that there were some issues with the air conditioning. The suite was stunning, with full length windows overlooking the Grand Canal, 2 small balconies (don't think you could sit out on them - standing room only!!!) and a mezzanine sleeping area. Slightly strange decoration but very luxurious. Bathroom was upstairs behind the bed in the sleeping area - a small bath with shower in it, single sink and separate toilet room (with no sink) on the other side of the bed. Very attractive, but unfortunately the gold leaf finish has really suffered from contact with water in places. You can see why when you start the shower - the water goes everywhere, even if you are careful. But all in all, a very attractive room, with automatic curtains so you can just lie in bed in the morning and push a button to see the view of the canal (and people breakfasting at the hotel opposite). Our daughter's room was at the back of the hotel with only a very limited view out of the back over the rooftops and one window with a view of a wall. Not great but what you expect in Venice if you don't pay a premium for Grand Canal view. Her bathroom was actually nicer than ours, with double sink and far more spacious. Again, the gold leaf finish wasn't holding up well. As we had been told, her room was very close to ours - diagonally across the hallway. The only problem was the key system, as she found it very difficult to open the door to her room - you had to hold the key to the pad and push the door at the same time. The door was very stiff and she found it really hard to get in without one of us to help her. We had a lovely night's sleep in these rooms (very dark and incredibly quiet given the location) and a great first day in Venice - starting with a fabulous breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. We battled for a table outside - there are about six on the deck over the canal, so if the hotel is full I'd imagine you'd be more likely to be inside, which is nice but not really as special as eating on the Grand Canal. Great spread of food and even Prosecco if you're not in a hurry to do anything (we weren't!!). Only thing to beware of is the seagulls - if you leave your table for even a moment they will swoop down and eat your food. We saw this happen to a couple of tables - predictably our daughter thought it was hilarious! When we got back to our rooms in the afternoon, we noticed that there was a puddle of water in the doorway to our suite. It turned out that the air conditioning was leaking. After much consultation, the maintenance team concluded that we'd have to move rooms. We were told that we'd be moving to 2 interconnecting junior suites on the second floor ('at no charge' - 'I should hope not!'). We packed up and the staff helped us move all our things. The two new rooms were lovely - with the same ceiling height as the suite but without the mezzanine. Again, full length windows over the Grand Canal and very luxurious. One was decorated in rich reds and the other in orange (or umber perhaps?). The bathrooms were far more spacious than the one in the suite, and again had the same issues with the gold leaf and a very leaky shower in one. We had to make a dam out of towels to have any hope of avoiding a total flood. Beds were fabulous and curtains made the rooms lovely and dark in the mornings. The fact that they were interconnecting would have made them a far better choice than our original rooms, as we didn't have to worry about our daughter letting herself out of her room and getting stranded in the corridor. In summary, potentially a great hotel - fabulous location (2 minutes from the traghetto over the Grand Canal, 2 minutes from the Guggenheim etc.), great service and spacious (for Venice!), modern rooms. However, I can't see the bathrooms lasting long without a total revamp, and they obviously need to sort out the A/C issues - they had to turn it off entirely for repairs on the morning we checked out, which with temperatures in the 30s outside wasn't ideal. If they sort out these issues I can't think of anywhere I'd rather stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Will DEFINITELY go back!”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Saunders
Reviews.Content: So - first off - go to Europe to enjoy it for what it is - wonderful and romantic and it's little imperfection are what give it charm and character. Europe is not always the Four Seasons (although I am a huge fan of their hotels and service) - but it is much more like the Centurion Place. Incredible staff (please give our very best regards to Emanuele, Stefano & Jorge), classic history, a fascination with modernism - and the odd tourist who complains about everything. Our stay at the Centurion had it all - and more. What a great location - looking across the water - away from the masses - and yet close to what makes Venice so wonderful - the locals. Our room was spectacular (we were upgraded to a 2 story suite) , the staff was wonderful and warm - and the setting was out of a movie set. And yes - we heard people complain abbout this and that - but they truly didn't get it. The Centurion IS what you go to Europe for - to get away, meet wonderful people - and take in the charm and romance. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel (in every sense of the word) in Venice”
Reviews.Author: helasuba
Reviews.Content: The wife and I have been fortunate enough to stay in many hotels in our time. However, this hotel by far was the BEST. We stayed for 6 nights. We booked a superior double room. It was AMAZING. the bed was very comfortable and large. the room had a his and hers stone sink. the bedroom had a bathtub as well as the rainfall shower in the bathroom. The room had a very powerful hairdryer, amenities, shower gel, shampoo, toothbrush, toothpaste, electronic safe, hangers etc. The room was cleaned twice a day. a forecast of the weather would be left along with chocolates every evening too. The complimentary breakfast every day was brilliant. A huge choice of fruit, croissants, pain aux chocolate, eggs, juice, hot drinks etc. Normally, I never get up for breakfast at hotels, but here, I was there everyday. also the view from the breakfast area in to the grand canal is unparalleled. Location - It is based based on the grand Canal, extremely close to the Academia Bridge and right next to Salute Vappereto stop. It is located close to a super market, shops, tourist sites and bridges. Could not imagine a better location to stay at on the entire grand canal. Service - The staff were extremely polite, friendly and extremely helpful. Cleanliness - extremely clean hotel If you are going to venice, dont think twice, STAY here. you will not regret it. The wife and I did our research for over two weeks and could not beat this hotel in terms of price, location and quality. If I visit Venice again, I would stay here. I have also recommended this to my friends. Regards The Saleh's

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bluegreenlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights ( 10th to 14th )and very much enjoyed it . Stayed in a junior suite which was spacious and clean and nicely decorated . The room had Great Canal views which was very enjoyable. It was quiet and friendly and the service and staff excellent . Reception/consierge were excellent too , always very helpful . Breakfast was very good . Also stayed for dinner one evening and again enjoyed it very muchThe hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfect time”
Reviews.Author: susan186230
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel service fantastic perfect location. We forgot our adaptor for our appliances and they were so helpful found one for me so quick . only one thing the room was quite small and the shower didn't work properly soaked the room so had to have a bath all the time still didn't spoil our time there as the fittings in the bathroom are lovely stayed in superior room but if stayed there again would definitely up grade next time as no view out of the room also but don't let that put you off breakfast were great sipping champers overlooking the grand canal couldn't be more perfect

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Modern Luxury Experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Columbray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Venice many times. We prefer staying in Dosoduro because it is relatively quiet and has excellent art-oriented shopping. This was our first stay in the Centurian Palace. (We travelled with friends who also stayed at the hotel.) We have stayed in many different hotels all generally 4 and 5 star. The Centurian Palace is without a doubt the best hotel experience we have had. The modern design of the hotel and the rooms are exceptional. Every aspect of the room is intended to delight the senses and no expense has been spared. But what makes a hotel rise above simple physical luxury is the attentiveness of the staff to your needs. And in this area the Centurian Palace is at the highest level along with the Bauer, Gritti Palace and Cipriani. The hotel is designed for a younger more creative demographic - typically movie people or attendees of the Venice Biannale. However, you don't have to be Johnny Depp to receive exceptional personal service. Our friends who stayed in one of the larger rooms were also incredibly impressed and also said that their stay was unmatched in Venice. If you want to experience the ultimate in modern design and luxury, you can not do better than the Centurian Palace.

HotelInfo.Name: Centurion Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 173, 30123 Venice, Italy
